title: The Top 10 Most Absurd Things That Have Happened This Year (So Far)

list: The government announced that it will now be measuring time in ***dog years***.
A new study found that the average person spends more time scrolling through their social media feed than they do sleeping.
A company released a line of ***smart*** socks that can send text messages and post on social media.
A group of activists demanded that all traffic lights be replaced with stop signs because they ***look more natural***.
A restaurant chain introduced a new menu item: ***a burger topped with a slice of cake***.

A fashion designer debuted a line of clothing made entirely out of recycled plastic water bottles. The outfits have been praised as ***eco-friendly*** and ***trendy***, but critics have pointed out that they also make a loud crinkling noise whenever the wearer moves.

A group of scientists claimed that they have discovered a way to make avocados taste like bacon. The announcement has been met with both excitement and skepticism, with many questioning whether the world is ready for such a revolutionary culinary breakthrough.
A politician announced that he will be running for office under the slogan ***Make America Great Again...Again***.
A company released a line of ***smart*** toilet paper that can play music and send tweets.
A group of protesters marched through the streets demanding that all cars be banned because ***they take up too much space and contribute to climate change***.

headline: Local News
title: New Study Shows Majority of People Actually Just Pretending to Like Craft Beer

section: In a shocking turn of events, a new study has revealed that the majority of people who claim to be craft beer aficionados are actually just pretending.

According to the study, these so-called ***craft beer connoisseurs*** are just faking their love for hoppy IPAs and funky sours to seem cool and edgy. In reality, they would much rather be chugging down cheap cans of mass-produced lagers in the privacy of their own homes.

***"We were really surprised by these findings,"*** said lead researcher, Dr. Mary Smith. ***"We always assumed that the craft beer craze was driven by a genuine appreciation for unique and artisanal brews. It turns out, it's just a bunch of people trying to fit in with the 'in-crowd'."***

The study also found that these fake craft beer lovers are more likely to be found at trendy bars and breweries, where they can be seen confidently spouting off beer jargon and pretending to know what ***mouthfeel*** means.
***"It's a sad state of affairs,"*** said Smith. ***"But at least now we know the truth. The majority of people claiming to love craft beer are just full of, well, you know."***

title: World Health Organization Announces That Stress is Actually Just a Myth

section: In a shocking announcement, the World Health Organization (WHO) has declared that stress is a myth and that people who claim to be stressed are just making it up.

According to Dr. Maria Hernandez, a spokesperson for the WHO, ***"We have conducted numerous studies and have come to the conclusion that stress does not exist. It's just a figment of people's imaginations."***

The announcement has caused a stir in the medical community, with many experts questioning the validity of the WHO's claim. ***"I find it hard to believe that stress isn't real,"*** said Dr. John Smith, a psychologist at the University of New York. ***"I see patients every day who are struggling with stress-related issues."***

Despite the criticism, the WHO remains firm in its belief that stress is a myth. ***"We encourage people to just relax and not worry about things,"*** said Dr. Hernandez. ***"It's all in your head."***
Some have even gone so far as to suggest that the WHO's announcement is a form of ***gaslighting***, with people being told that their legitimate concerns and struggles are not real.

Regardless, it seems that the WHO's announcement has had little effect on the general population, with many people continuing to report feeling stressed on a daily basis. It remains to be seen how this controversy will play out in the coming weeks and months.

title: Trump Administration Unveils Plan to Build Wall Around the Sun

section: The Trump Administration has announced their plan to build a wall around the sun. According to White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the sun poses a threat to national security and action must be taken to protect American citizens.

***"This wall will be the most advanced solar defense system in the world,"*** Sanders declared. ***"It will be big and beautiful, just like the rest of Trump's wall projects. And it will make America great again."***

However, many are skeptical about the feasibility of such a project. ***"How exactly do you plan on building a wall around the sun?"*** asked Representative Nancy Pelosi. ***"It's a celestial body, not a piece of land. And what about the cost? The taxpayer dollars being spent on this ridiculous wall could be put to much better use."***

Despite the criticism, the Trump Administration remains determined to move forward with their plan. ***"We have the best engineers and the best technology,"*** said President Trump. ***"We will get this wall done, and it will be a tremendous success. Believe me."***
The announcement has sparked outrage and disbelief among the general public. ***"I can't believe this is real,"*** said one Twitter user. ***"Is this some kind of joke?"***

Only time will tell if the Trump Administration's plan to build a wall around the sun will become a reality. But one thing is certain: ***the absurdity of American politics continues to reach new heights.***

title: Experts: Global Economic Collapse Just a Coincidence, Definitely Not the Result of Reckless, Short-Sighted Policies

section: In a shocking revelation, experts have announced that the global economic collapse currently being experienced by countries around the world is just a coincidence, and definitely not the result of reckless, short-sighted policies enacted by government leaders.

According to leading economist Dr. John Smith, the collapse is simply a ***"random occurrence"*** and has nothing to do with the fact that governments have been printing unlimited amounts of money, leading to skyrocketing inflation and the devaluation of currencies.
***"It's just a fluke,"*** Dr. Smith said. ***"Nothing to worry about."***

However, not everyone is convinced by this explanation. Many are pointing to the fact that government leaders have ignored warning signs and continued to engage in risky financial practices, leading to the current state of economic turmoil.

Despite this, experts assure the public that there is no cause for concern and that the collapse will resolve itself eventually. In the meantime, they recommend continuing to trust in the system and not making any hasty financial decisions.
***"Just sit tight and everything will work out,"*** Dr. Smith said with a reassuring smile. ***"We promise."***

title: Government Announces Plan to Replace All Forms of Communication with Emoji-Only Text Messages

section: In a shocking move, the government has announced plans to phase out all forms of traditional communication, including verbal, written, and even sign language. The new plan, dubbed ***"Emoji-Only,"*** will require all citizens to communicate exclusively through a series of carefully selected emojis.

***"We believe this will streamline communication and make it more efficient,"*** said a spokesperson for the Department of Emoji Affairs. ***"Plus, it'll be a lot more fun. Who doesn't love emojis?"***

The transition to Emoji-Only will be gradual, with mandatory training sessions for all citizens. Those who struggle with the new system will be given additional support, including Emoji tutors and a comprehensive Emoji dictionary.

Critics have raised concerns about the potential for miscommunication and the lack of nuance in emoji-based communication. However, supporters of the plan argue that with enough practice, anyone can master the art of emoji.

The government is encouraging all citizens to start practicing their Emoji-Only skills as soon as possible, with the goal of fully implementing the system by the end of the year. In the meantime, prepare to say goodbye to words and hello to a whole new world of emojis.

title: New Study Shows That Making the Stupid Even Stupider is Actually Possible

section: In a shocking new study, researchers at the Institute of Really Obvious Things have discovered that it is actually possible to make the stupid even stupider.

According to lead researcher Dr. Susan Smart, the team was able to achieve this feat by subjecting the already dim-witted to an endless stream of reality TV shows, conspiracy theories, and viral Facebook posts.
***"We were really surprised by the results,"*** said Dr. Smart. ***"We thought these people couldn't get any dumber, but we were wrong. The potential applications of this technology are endless."***

The news has been met with mixed reactions, with some calling it a miraculous breakthrough and others decrying it as a form of torture. Regardless, the team at the Institute of Really Obvious Things is already looking into ways to monetize their discovery, with plans to open 'stupidity spas' and sell 'stupidity supplements' in the near future.
In the meantime, the rest of us can only hope that the stupid stay blissfully unaware of their own idiocy and continue to make poor life choices without any additional help.
